channel.title: Bean There Done That
channel.description: Bean There Done That is a space for nontraditional stories to live in the traditional space of a podcast...all over a cup of coffee. Each episode I sit down with a different human, whether they are an artist, a musician, a community builder, or simply someone who has hacked an interesting life to learn what makes them tick, how they've grown, and what makes up their whole bean.
channel.author: Sana Shah
channel.itunes:author: Sana Shah
channel.itunes:summary: Bean There Done That is a space for nontraditional stories to live in the traditional space of a podcast...all over a cup of coffee. Each episode I sit down with a different human, whether they are an artist, a musician, a community builder, or simply someone who has hacked an interesting life to learn what makes them tick, how they've grown, and what makes up their whole bean.

item.title: 4 - Q&A with Sana Shah + Sarwat Kazmi
item.description: This week we are giving you all a Q&A + FAQ episode with a special interviewer, my dearest gal pal Sarwat Kazmi: a student at University of Maryland studying Information Science and Government and Politics with her own radio show about being single on campus. We talked about design, being creative, and coffee! --- This episode is sponsored by · Anchor: The easiest way to make a podcast. https://anchor.fm/app
item.dc:creator: Sana Shah
item.itunes:summary: This week we are giving you all a Q&A + FAQ episode with a special interviewer, my dearest gal pal Sarwat Kazmi: a student at University of Maryland studying Information Science and Government and Politics with her own radio show about being single on campus. item.title: 3 - The Balance of Creation and Staying Accessible
item.description: This week we sat down with Clarissa Corey Bey or (as they’re known on social media) Sweet: a non binary, black, queer artist and musical director of the energetic and cosmic group Black Folks Don’t Swim? We discussed food, music, the process of creation, staying accessible and inclusive, and how being at the intersection of many identities keeps a person cognizant of others’ realities. And of course...communication blocks! --- This episode is sponsored by · Anchor: The easiest way to make a podcast. https://anchor.fm/app

item.title: 2 - Speculating Worlds and Building Intent
item.description: This episode we sit down with Mandla Dunn, also known as Kosi. He is an artist mentor at the ARTLAB at the Hirshorn Museum and an avid DnD dungeon master. We sat down at the ARTLAB with some cappuccinos from Dolcezza and discussed anthropology, world building, Edward Said, Sofia Samatar, art with intent, and love languages. --- This episode is sponsored by · Anchor: The easiest way to make a podcast. https://anchor.fm/app

item.title: 1 - Freelancing and Breaking the Fixed Mindset
item.description: This week we sat down with freelance photographer Ammar Habib at Vigilante Coffee to talk about his diverse breadth of experience from design to psychology to consulting, how we process our weaknesses, music, fixed vs. growth mindsets, our communication blocks, and where he is in his career as a freelancer. --- This episode is sponsored by · Anchor: The easiest way to make a podcast. https://anchor.fm/app
